distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for kernel is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The kernel packages contain the Linux kernel, the core of any Linux operating system.

Security Fix(es):

* It was found that the Linux kernel's IPv6 implementation mishandled socket options. A local attacker could abuse concurrent access to the socket options to escalate their privileges, or cause a denial of service (use-after-free and system crash) via a crafted sendmsg system call. (CVE-2016-3841, Important)

Additional Changes:

Space precludes documenting all of the bug fixes and enhancements included in this advisory. To see the complete list of bug fixes and enhancements, refer to the following KnowledgeBase article: https://access.redhat.com/articles/2754251
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: kernel security, bug fix, and enhancement update

notes.text: It was found that the Linux kernel's IPv6 implementation mishandled socket options. A local attacker could abuse concurrent access to the socket options to escalate their privileges, or cause a denial of service (use-after-free and system crash) via a crafted sendmsg system call.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: use-after-free via crafted IPV6 sendmsg for raw / tcp / udp / l2tp sockets.
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This issue affects Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7 kernels.  This issue was fixed in a version 6 prior to this issue being raised.

As this issue is rated as important, it has been scheduled to be fixed in a future version of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: use-after-free via crafted IPV6 sendmsg for raw / tcp / udp / l2tp sockets.
